New Records: It will be the first matchup of Japanese-born starting pitchers in Major League postseason history.
Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto will start for the Dodgers against Yu Darvish in Game 5 of the National League Division Series.
In a must-win Game 4, the Dodgers used eight relievers to shut out the Padres and win 8-0, setting up Friday's dramatic finale.
Pre-Game Insights: Shohei Ohtani had been anticipating the matchup earlier in the series, when Yoshinobu was slated to start Game 2 against Darvish.
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts didn't name a starter earlier Thursday, saying only that Yamamoto 'will be a part of it.'
Padres manager Mike Shildt compared his team's approach to that of Vince Lombardi, emphasizing straightforwardness and determination to win.
The Dodgers expect All-Star first baseman Freddie Freeman to be back in the lineup after he was a late scratch for Game 4 with a sprained right ankle.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Fans tossing balls and trash on the field caused a 12-minute delay in Game 2 last week.
Yamamoto is the highest paid pitcher in the majors, having signed a $325 million, 12-year deal with the Dodgers in December.
Yu Darvish was last on the Dodger Stadium mound for an elimination game in the 2017 World Series.
